meanings.definition: To draw the wrong conclusion from something.
meanings.sent1: She kept misinferring the teacher's instructions and ended up doing the wrong assignment.
meanings.sent2: He realized he was misinferring the map and turned left instead of right.
meanings.sent3: The detective was misinferring the clues, thinking the butler was the culprit when it was actually the maid.
meanings.sent4: By misinferring the signs, she missed the opportunity of a lifetime.
meanings.sent5: Misinferring the weather forecast, he went out without an umbrella and got soaked in the rain.

meanings.sent1: They were misinferring the data, leading to incorrect conclusions.
meanings.sent2: The scientist realized he was misinferring the results of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: By misinferring the tone of the message, she thought he was angry when he was actually joking.
meanings.sent4: Misinferring the situation, he thought she was upset when she was just tired.
meanings.sent5: The student kept misinferring the text, getting all the quiz questions wrong.
